sen.j: 進氏（しんし）は南北朝時代 (日本)から室町時代にかけて伯耆国西部（西伯耆）に勢力を持っていた国人。
sen.e: The Shin clan was a local ruling family who was influential in the western part of Hoki Province (West Hoki) from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts to the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 進氏は平安時代末期、西伯耆を中心に勢力を誇っていた紀氏、紀成盛を祖とする一族で代々、会見郡から日野郡にかけて権益を持っていた。
sen.e: The Shin clan was a family originated from KI no Narimori, the Ki clan, who reigned the territories centering on West Hoki at the end of the Heian period, and had interests from Aimi county to Hino county for generations.
sen.cmt: 「進氏は平安時代末期、西伯耆を中心に勢力を誇っていた紀氏、紀成盛を祖とする一族」ですが、「西伯耆を中心に勢力を誇っていた」のは,「平安時代末期」とあるので、「紀氏」と理解しました。
sen.e: The Shin clan originated from KI no Narimori who had been a member of the Ki clan, a powerful clan at the end of the Heian period; the Ki clan had had its base in West Hoki and the Shin clan was still powerful in West Hoki especially in Aimi County and Hino County for generations.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: The Shin clan originated from KI no Narimori who had been a member of the Ki clan, a powerful clan at the end of the Heian period; the Ki clan had had its base in West Hoki and the Shin clan was still powerful in West Hoki especially in Aimi County and Hino County for generations.

sen.j: 当初は巨勢氏、相見氏ともいい、船上山合戦に馳せ参じた際、その戦功を称えられ後醍醐天皇より綸旨が与えられた。
sen.e: The clan formerly used others names or Kose and Aimi, and when the clan joined the battle of Mt. Senjo-san and made a good showing, the clan was granted rinji, a kind of document issued by the Emperor, from Emperor Godaigo for their military exploits.
sen.cmt: 綸旨は一言で言い表せません。
sen.e: The clan initially called themselves the Kose clan or the Aimi clan; at the Battle of Mt. Senjo, they rushed to the battlefield to support Emperor Godaigo, and later for the achievements in the battle, they were given Rinji (emperor's important document) and praised by the emperor.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: The clan initially called themselves the Kose clan or the Aimi clan; at the Battle of Mt. Senjo, they rushed to the battlefield to support Emperor Godaigo, and later for the achievements in the battle, they were given Rinji (emperor's important document) and praised by the emperor.

sen.j: この綸旨は現在でも実物が伝えられているが、これを与えられた巨勢氏・会見氏が進氏につながる一族であるのか不明な点も多い。
sen.e: This rinji still survives today, but there are many unknown points about whether or not the Kose clan or Aimi clan who were granted this document became the Shin clan.
There still remains this Rinji, however, it is unclear whether the Kose clan and the Aimi clan to which the emperor gave this document was the original clan of the Shin clan or not.

sen.j: 文献に見える一番古い記録は興国6年（貞和元年、1345年）の山城国嘉祥寺領伯耆国布美庄に関するもので進三郎入道長覚が領家職を押領しようとしたとの記録が最古である（布美庄は現在の米子市付近に位置していた）。
sen.e: The oldest documented record of the Shin clan is about the territory of Fumi-sho village, Hoki Province, and Kajo-ji Temple in Yamashiro Province in 1345 and describes the attempted seizure of ryoke shiki (an economical right as a lord of the manor) by Saburo SHIN, priest Chokaku.
sen.cmt: 山城国嘉祥寺領伯耆国布美庄は、「山城国嘉祥寺領」と「伯耆国布美庄」の2つの領地のことか不明です。
sen.e: The oldest record on the Shin clan is about Fumi-sho Manor in Hoki Province which had been possessed by Kajo-ji Temple of Yamashiro Province; according to the article, in 1345, SHIN no Saburo Nyudo (priest Chokaku) tried to take Ryokeshiki (an economical right as a lord of a manor); Fumi-sho Manor was located near present Yonago City.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。翻訳者の指摘のように、オリジナルの括弧が適切に処理されていませんでしたので、直します。

sen.j: 室町時代には山名氏のもとで伯耆衆の一員になり応仁の乱に参加、その功によって進美濃守は南条氏と共に伯耆守護代に任じられた。
sen.e: (Fumi-sho is located near today's Yonago city) In the Muromachi period, the Shin clan became a member of the local clans of Hoki Province under the banner of the Yamana clan, participated in the Onin War, Shin Mino no kami was appointed as Shugo-dai (acting Military Governor) of Hoki Province for his military achievements together with the Nanjo clan.
sen.cmt: 最初のカッコは、どちらに付くのか不明です。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, the Shin clan supported the Yamana clan and became a member of Hokishu (the local clans of Hoki Province); at the Onin War, they fought as Hokishu and made achievements, and at a result, they were appointed as Shugodai (deputy of Military Governor) of Hoki Province as well as the Nanjo clan.
sen.cmt: 用語の統一。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, the Shin clan supported the Yamana clan and became a member of Hokishu (the local clans of Hoki Province); at the Onin War, they fought as Hokishu and made achievements, and as a result, they were appointed as Shugodai (deputy of Military Governor) of Hoki Province as well as the Nanjo clan.

sen.j: このほか中央の文献には当時、伯耆国内で有力であった小鴨氏、南条氏、村上氏_(伯耆国)などと並んで進氏の名が記されており、西伯耆の有力者であったことがうかがい知れる。
sen.e: Documents issued in those days in Kyoto mention the name of the Shin clan together with the Kogamo clan, Nanjo clan, and Murakami clan (Hoki Province) as powerful clans in Hoki, which indicate the Shin clan was also a powerful family in West Hoki.
sen.cmt: 中央の文献とは何か不明です。
sen.e: In some records of the administrations, the name of the Shin clan is found as well as the Kogamo clan, Nanjo clan, Murakami clan of Hoki Province and so on which were powerful clans in Hoki Province in those days, therefore, the Shin clan is considered to have been one of such influential clans in West Hoki.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。

sen.e: This clearly indicates that the Shin clan, who served as Shugo-dai in the age of Noriyuki YAMANA, began to keep a distance from the Yamana clan as the era changed to Meio for independence.

sen.j: その後の一族の動向は不明だが、天正年間からは東伯耆の南条氏家臣に進下総守が確認され、一部の者は他の有力者の家臣に組み込まれていったものと推察される。
sen.e: Although there is no record about the clan in years thereafter, it is documented after the era of Tensho that Shin Shimousa-no-kami was among the vassals of the Nanjo clan of East Hoki and is speculated that some of the Shin clan members were incorporated into the vassalage of other powerful clans.

Although there is no record about the clan in years thereafter, in the records after Tensho era, "Shin Shimosa no kami" who was a vassal of the Nanjo clan is found, therefore, presumably some of the clan became vassals of other powerful clans.
sen.cmt: 用語の統一。「かみ」についても他の用例に従います。
